Package com.unitedbankingservices

Class AbstractDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>

java.lang.Object
com.unitedbankingservices.AbstractDevice<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of listeners used for this device. For a device whose class is X, its corresponding listener interface would typically be XObserver.
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDevice<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractBanknoteDispenser, AbstractCoinDispenser, BanknoteDispensationSlot, BanknoteInsertionSlot, BanknoteStorageUnit, BanknoteValidator, CoinSlot, CoinStorageUnit, CoinTray, CoinValidator
public abstract class AbstractDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver> extends Object implements IDevice<T>
The abstract base class for all devices from United Banking Services.

This class utilizes the Observer design pattern. Subclasses inherit the attach method, but each must define its own notifyXXX methods.

Each device must be coupled to an appropriate listener interface, which extends AbstractDeviceObserver; the type parameter T represents this listener.

Any individual device can be disabled, which means it will not permit physical movements to be caused by the software. Any method that could cause a physical movement will declare that it throws DisabledException.

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Attempts to turn on the power to this device. If the device is already active or if it is disconnected from the power grid, this method does nothing.

      public void disactivate()

    • detach

      public final boolean detach(T observer)
      Locates the indicated observer and removes it such that it will no longer be informed of events from this device. If the observer is not currently registered with this device, calls to this method will return false, but otherwise have no effect.
      Specified by:
      detach in interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the observer was found and removed, false otherwise.

    • detachAll

      public final void detachAll()
      All observers registered with this device are removed. If there are none, calls to this method have no effect.
      Specified by:
      detachAll in interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>

    • attach

      public final void attach(T observer)
      Registers the indicated observer to receive event notifications from this device.
      Specified by:
      attach in interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>
      Parameters:
      observer - The observer to be added.
      Throws:
      NullPointerSimulationException - If the argument is null.

    • disable

      public final void disable()
      Disables this device from receiving input and producing output. Announces "disabled" event. Requires power.
      Specified by:

    • isDisabled

      public final boolean isDisabled()
      Returns whether this device is currently disabled from receiving input and producing output. Requires power.
      Specified by:
      isDisabled in interface IDevice<T extends IDeviceObserver>
      Returns:
